001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFontCache;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.GlyphLayout;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer.ShapeType;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
012import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor;
013import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.ScrollPane;
014import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Align;
015import squidpony.panel.IColoredString;
016import squidpony.panel.IMarkup;
017import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx.UIUtil.CornerStyle;
018
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.Collection;
021
022/**
023 * A panel to display some text using libgdx directly (i.e. without using
024 * {@link SquidPanel}) as in these examples (no scrolling first, then with a
025 * scroll bar):
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * <ul>
029 * <li><img src="http://i.imgur.com/EqEXqlu.png"/></li>
030 * <li><img src="http://i.imgur.com/LYbxQZE.png"/></li>
031 * </ul>
032 * </p>
033 *
034 * <p>
035 * It supports vertical scrolling, i.e. it'll put a vertical scrollbar if
036 * there's too much text to display. This class does a lot of stuff, you
037 * typically only have to provide the textures for the scrollbars and the scroll
038 * knobs (see example below).
039 * </p>
040 *
041 * <p>
042 * A typical usage of this class is as follows:
043 *
044 * <pre>
045 * final TextPanel<Color> tp = new TextPanel<>(new GDXMarkup(), font);
046 * tp.init(screenWidth, screenHeight, text); <- first 2 params: for fullscreen
047 * final ScrollPane sp = tp.getScrollPane();
048 * sp.setScrollPaneStyle(new ScrollPaneStyle(...)); <- set textures
049 * stage.addActor(sp);
050 * stage.setScrollFocus(sp);
051 * stage.draw();
052 * </pre>
053 * </p>
054 *
055 * <p>
056 * This class shares what {@link ScrollPane} does (knobs, handling of the wheel).
057 * </p>
058 * <p>
059 * Drawing the result of {@link #getScrollPane()} will set the shader of {@code batch} if using a distance field or MSDF
060 * font and the shader is currently not configured for such a font; it does not reset the shader to the default so that
061 * multiple Actors can all use the same shader and so specific extra glyphs or other items can be rendered after calling
062 * draw(). If you need to draw both a distance field font and full-color art, you should set the shader on the Batch to
063 * null when you want to draw full-color art, and end the Batch between drawing this object and the other art.
064 * </p>
065 * @author smelC
066 *
067 * @see ScrollPane A libGDX widget for general scrolling through only the visible part of a large widget
068 * @see LinesPanel An alternative for displaying lines of text in a variable-width font
069 */
070public class TextPanel<T extends Color> {
071
072        /**
073         * The color to use to paint the background (outside buttons) using
074         * {@link ShapeRenderer}. Or {@code null} to disable background coloring.
075         */
076        public /* @Nullable */ T backgroundColor;
077
078        /**
079         * The color of the border around this panel, if any. If set, it'll be
080         * rendered using {@link ShapeRenderer} and {@link #borderStyle}.
081         */
082        public /* @Nullable */ T borderColor;
083
084        /** The size of the border, if any */
085        public float borderSize;
086
087        public CornerStyle borderStyle = CornerStyle.ROUNDED;
088
089        protected /* @Nullable */ IMarkup<T> markup;
090
091        protected BitmapFont font;
092        protected TextCellFactory tcf;
093        /** The text to display */
094        public ArrayList<IColoredString<T>> text;
095
096        protected final ScrollPane scrollPane;
097
098        /**
099         * The actor whose size is adjusted to the text. When scrolling is required,
100         * it is bigger than {@link #scrollPane}.
101         */
102        protected final Actor textActor;
103
104        /** Do not access directly, use {@link #getRenderer()} */
105        private /* @Nullable */ ShapeRenderer renderer;
106
107        /**
108         * The text to display MUST be set later on with
109         * {@link #init(float, float, Collection)}.
110         *
111         * @param markup ignored.
112         * @param font
113         *            The font to use. It can be set later using
114         *            {@link #setFont(BitmapFont)}, but it MUST be set before
115         *            drawing this panel.
116         */
117        public TextPanel(/* @Nullable */IMarkup<T> markup, /* @Nullable */ BitmapFont font) {
118                if (font != null)
119                        setFont(font);
120                textActor = new TextActor();
121
122                this.scrollPane = new ScrollPane(textActor);
123        }
124
125        /**
126         * The text to display MUST be set later on with {@link #init(float, float, Collection)} (which can't be updated) or
127         * {@link #initShared(float, float, ArrayList)} (which reflects changes in the given ArrayList).
128         *
129         * @param markup
130         *            An optional way to compute markup.
131         * @param font
132         *            A TextCellFactory, typically holding a distance field font ("stretchable" or "crisp" in
133         *            DefaultResources). This won't force glyphs into same-size cells, despite the name.
134         */
135        public TextPanel(/* @Nullable */IMarkup<T> markup, /* @Nullable */ TextCellFactory font) {
136                if (font != null)
137                {
138                        tcf = font;
139                        tcf.initBySize();
140                        this.font = tcf.font();
141                }
142                textActor = new TextActor();
143                scrollPane = new ScrollPane(textActor);
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Sets the font to use. This method should be called once before {@link #init(float, float, Collection)} if the
148         * font wasn't given at creation-time.
149         *
150         * @param font The font to use as a BitmapFont.
151         */
152        public void setFont(BitmapFont font) {
153                this.font = font;
154                tcf = new TextCellFactory().font(font).height(MathUtils.ceil(font.getLineHeight()))
155                                .width(MathUtils.round(font.getSpaceXadvance()));
156        }
157
158        /**
159         * Sets the font to use. This method should be called once before {@link #init(float, float, Collection)} if the
160         * font wasn't given at creation-time.
161         *
162         * @param font The font to use as a TextCellFactory.
163         */
164        public void setFont(TextCellFactory font) {
165                if (font != null)
166                {
167                        tcf = font;
168                        tcf.initBySize();
169                        this.font = tcf.font();
170                }
171        }
172
173        /**
174         * This method sets the sizes of {@link #scrollPane} and {@link #textActor}.
175         * This method MUST be called before rendering.
176         *
177         * @param maxHeight
178         *            The maximum height that the scrollpane can take (equal or
179         *            smaller than the height of the text actor).
180         * @param width
181         *            The width of the scrollpane and the text actor.
182         * @param text
183         */
184        public void init(float width, float maxHeight, Collection<? extends IColoredString<T>> text) {
185                this.text = new ArrayList<>(text);
186
187                scrollPane.setWidth(width);
188                textActor.setWidth(width);
189
190                if (tcf == null)
191                        throw new NullPointerException(
192                                        "The font should be set before calling TextPanel.init()");
193
194                //prepareText();
195//              final boolean yscroll = maxHeight < textActor.getHeight();
196                scrollPane.setHeight(maxHeight);
197                scrollPane.setActor(textActor);
198                //yScrollingCallback(yscroll);
199                scrollPane.layout();
200        }
201
202        /**
203         * This method sets the sizes of {@link #scrollPane} and {@link #textActor}, and shares a direct reference to
204         * {@code text} so changes to that ArrayList will also be picked up here and rendered.
205         * This method MUST be called before rendering.
206         *
207         * @param maxHeight
208         *            The maximum height that the scrollpane can take (equal or
209         *            smaller than the height of the text actor).
210         * @param width
211         *            The width of the scrollpane and the text actor.
212         * @param text an ArrayList of IColoredString that will be used directly by this TextPanel (changes
213         *             to the ArrayList will show up in the TextPanel)
214         */
215        public void initShared(float width, float maxHeight, ArrayList<IColoredString<T>> text) {
216                this.text = text;
217
218                scrollPane.setWidth(width);
219                textActor.setWidth(width);
220
221                if (tcf == null)
222                        throw new NullPointerException(
223                                        "The font should be set before calling TextPanel.init()");
224
225                //prepareText();
226//              final boolean yscroll = maxHeight < textActor.getHeight();
227                scrollPane.setHeight(maxHeight);
228                scrollPane.setActor(textActor);
229                //yScrollingCallback(yscroll);
230                scrollPane.layout();
231        }
232
233        public void init(float width, float maxHeight, T color, String... text)
234        {
235                ArrayList<IColoredString.Impl<T>> coll = new ArrayList<>(text.length);
236                for(String t : text)
237                {
238                        coll.add(new IColoredString.Impl<>(t, color));
239                }
240                init(width, maxHeight, coll);
241        }
242
243        /**
244         * Draws the border. You have to call this method manually, because the
245         * border is outside the actor and hence should be drawn at the very end,
246         * otherwise it can get overwritten by UI elements.
247         *
248         * @param batch
249         */
250        public void drawBorder(Batch batch) {
251                if (borderColor != null && 0 < borderSize) {
252                        final boolean reset = batch.isDrawing();
253                        if (reset)
254                                batch.end();
255
256                        final ShapeRenderer sr = getRenderer();
257                        final Matrix4 m = batch.getTransformMatrix();
258                        sr.setTransformMatrix(m);
259                        sr.begin(ShapeType.Filled);
260                        sr.setColor(borderColor);
261//                      prepareText();
262                        final float down = font.getData().down;
263                        UIUtil.drawMarginsAround(sr, scrollPane.getX(), scrollPane.getY() + down * -0.5f + 4f, scrollPane.getWidth(),
264                                        scrollPane.getHeight() + down * -1.5f - 4f, borderSize * 2f, borderColor, borderStyle, 1f, 1f);
265                        sr.end();
266
267                        if (reset)
268                                batch.begin();
269                }
270        }
271
272        /**
273         * @return The text to draw, without color information present in {@link #text}.
274         */
275        public /* @Nullable */ ArrayList<String> getTypesetText() {
276                if (text == null)
277                        return null;
278                final ArrayList<String> result = new ArrayList<>();
279                for (IColoredString<T> line : text) {
280                        result.add(line.present());
281                }
282                return result;
283        }
284
285        /**
286         * Updates the text this will show based on the current contents of the ArrayList of IColoredString values that may
287         * be shared due to {@link #initShared(float, float, ArrayList)}, then resizes the {@link #getTextActor()} to fit
288         * the current text and lays out the {@link #getScrollPane()} to match. Called in the text actor's draw() method. 
289         */
290        protected void prepareText() {
291                if (text == null)
292                        return;
293                final BitmapFontCache cache = font.getCache();
294                //cache.clear();
295                final float w = scrollPane.getWidth();
296                float lineHeight = -font.getData().down, capHeight = font.getCapHeight();
297                int lines = 1, ci = 0;
298                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(256);
299                for (int m = 0, textSize = text.size(); m < textSize; m++) {
300                        IColoredString<T> line = text.get(m);
301                        ArrayList<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> frags = line.getFragments();
302                        for (int i = 0; i < frags.size(); i++) {
303                                sb.append(frags.get(i).getText());
304                        }
305                        sb.append('\n');
306                }
307                GlyphLayout layout = cache.setText(sb, 0, 0, w, Align.left, true);                      
308                lines += layout.height / capHeight;
309                
310                for (int m = 0, textSize = text.size(); m < textSize; m++) {
311                        IColoredString<T> line = text.get(m);
312                        ArrayList<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> frags = line.getFragments();
313                        for (int i = 0; i < frags.size(); i++) {
314                                final IColoredString.Bucket<T> b = frags.get(i);
315                                Color c = b.getColor();
316                                if(c != null) 
317                                        cache.setColors(c, ci, ci += b.length());
318                                else
319                                        ci += b.length();
320                        }
321
322//                      if(m + 1 < textSize)
323//                      {
324                                //cache.addText("\n", pos, (-lines) * totalTextHeight, w, Align.left, true);
325                                //lines++;
326//                      }
327                }
328                lineHeight *= lines;
329                if(lineHeight < 0)
330                        lineHeight = 0;
331                textActor.setHeight(/* Entire height */ lineHeight);
332                scrollPane.layout();
333
334        }
335
336        /**
337         * Scrolls the scroll pane this holds down by some number of rows (which may be fractional, and may be negative to
338         * scroll up). This is not a smooth scroll, and will not be animated.
339         * @param downDistance The distance in rows to scroll down, which can be negative to scroll up instead
340         */
341        public void scroll(final float downDistance)
342        {
343                prepareText();
344                scrollPane.setScrollY(scrollPane.getScrollY() + downDistance * tcf.actualCellHeight);
345        }
346
347        /**
348         * If the parameter is true, scrolls to the top of this scroll pane; otherwise scrolls to the bottom. This is not a
349         * smooth scroll, and will not be animated.
350         * @param goToTop If true, will scroll to the top edge; if false, will scroll to the bottom edge.
351         */
352        public void scrollToEdge(final boolean goToTop)
353        {
354                prepareText();
355                scrollPane.setScrollPercentY(goToTop ? 0f : 1f);
356        }
357
358        /**
359         * @return The {@link ScrollPane} containing {@link #getTextActor()}.
360         */
361        public ScrollPane getScrollPane() {
362                return scrollPane;
363        }
364
365        /**
366         * @return The {@link Actor} where the text is drawn. It may be bigger than
367         *         {@link #getScrollPane()}.
368         */
369        public Actor getTextActor() {
370                return textActor;
371        }
372
373        /**
374         * @return The font used, if set, as a TextCellFactory (one is always created even if only given a BitmapFont).
375         */
376        public /* @Nullable */ TextCellFactory getFont() {
377                return tcf;
378        }
379
380        public void dispose() {
381                if (renderer != null)
382                        renderer.dispose();
383        }
384
385        /**
386         * Callback done to do stuff according to whether y-scrolling is required
387         *
388         * @param required
389         *            Whether y scrolling is required.
390         */
391        protected void yScrollingCallback(boolean required) {
392                if (required) {
393                        /* Disable borders, they don't mix well with scrollbars */
394                        borderSize = 0;
395                        scrollPane.setFadeScrollBars(false);
396                        scrollPane.setForceScroll(false, true);
397                }
398        }
399
400        /**
401         * @param ics
402         *            Text set when building {@code this}
403         * @return The text to display to screen. If you wanna
404         *         {@link squidpony.IColorCenter#filter(IColoredString) filter} your
405         *         text , do it here.
406         */
407        protected IColoredString<T> present(IColoredString<T> ics) {
408                return ics;
409        }
410
411        /**
412         * @return A fresh renderer.
413         */
414        protected ShapeRenderer buildRenderer() {
415                return new ShapeRenderer();
416        }
417
418        /**
419         * @return The renderer to use.
420         */
421        protected ShapeRenderer getRenderer() {
422                if (renderer == null)
423                        renderer = buildRenderer();
424                return renderer;
425        }
426
427        private class TextActor extends Actor
428        {
429                TextActor()
430                {
431
432                }
433                @Override
434                public void draw(Batch batch, float parentAlpha) {
435                        prepareText();
436                        final float tx = 0f;//scrollPane.getX();
437                        final float ty = 0f;//scrollPane.getY();
438                        final float twidth = scrollPane.getWidth();
439                        final float theight = scrollPane.getHeight();
440
441                        if (backgroundColor != null) {
442                                batch.setColor(backgroundColor);
443                                batch.draw(tcf.getSolid(), tx, ty, twidth, theight);
444                                batch.setColor(SColor.WHITE);
445                /*
446                batch.end();
447
448                final Matrix4 m = batch.getTransformMatrix();
449                final ShapeRenderer sr = getRenderer();
450                sr.setTransformMatrix(m);
451                sr.begin(ShapeType.Filled);
452                sr.setColor(backgroundColor);
453                UIUtil.drawRectangle(renderer, tx, ty, twidth, theight, ShapeType.Filled,
454                        backgroundColor);
455                sr.end();
456
457                batch.begin();
458                */
459                        }
460
461                        if (font == null)
462                                throw new NullPointerException(
463                                                "The font should be set when drawing a TextPanel's TextActor");
464                        if (text == null)
465                                throw new NullPointerException(
466                                                "The font should be set when drawing a TextPanel's TextActor");
467                        if (tcf != null) {
468                                tcf.configureShader(batch);
469                        }
470//                      final float offY = 0;//(tcf != null) ? tcf.actualCellHeight * 0.5f : 0;
471                        final BitmapFontCache cache = font.getCache();
472                        cache.setPosition(tx, scrollPane.getHeight() + scrollPane.getScrollY());
473                        cache.draw(batch);
474                }
475        }
476
477}
